pullrequest.title: Andrei Haidu GSOC fluid plugin with Fluidix

content.raw:
My one hesitation about this plugin is that Fluidix is not open-source. http://onezero.ca/license-agreement-non-com/

It would be awesome to integrate fluid simulation with Gazebo, but the Fluidix non-commercial license agreement could be an obstacle to the widespread usage of this plugin. There are open source [fluid simulators](http://www.rchoetzlein.com/fluids3/?page_id=13), and it might be more useful to the world if the fluid plugin backend was freely available and instantly downloadable.
content.html:
My one hesitation about this plugin is that Fluidix is not open-source. http://onezero.ca/license-agreement-non-com/

It would be awesome to integrate fluid simulation with Gazebo, but the Fluidix non-commercial license agreement could be an obstacle to the widespread usage of this plugin. There are open source fluid simulators, and it might be more useful to the world if the fluid plugin backend was freely available and instantly downloadable.
